content.question: Directions: The suggested time for answering this question is about 22 minutes. Where calculations are required, clearly show how you arrived at your answer. Where explanation or discussion is required, support your answers with relevant information and/or specific examples. The six criteria pollutants used by the Environmental Protection Agency to assess air quality in the United States are <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>NO</mtext> </mrow> <mtext>2</mtext> </msub> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3878@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>SO</mtext> </mrow> <mtext>2</mtext> </msub> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@387D@</annotation> </semantics> </math> , carbon monoxide, lead, ozone, and particulates. The graphs above show trends in the concentration of four of these in a certain city in the United States. Describe and compare the concentration trends for ozone and lead. Calculate the percentage change in each from 1978 to 1988. For either ozone or lead, identify the major source(s) of that pollutant and describe the main physiological effects in humans. For either particulates or carbon monoxide, identify the major source(s) of that pollutant and describe the most effective method of reducing the concentration of the pollutant in the atmosphere.

skill.text: Skill 6.B: Apply appropriate mathematical relationships to solve a problem, with work shown (e.g., dimensional analysis).
